DOC.HEAD: Firebomb Thrown at Romanian Embassy in Israel
With AM-Romania, Bjt
DOC.TEXT: A firebomb was thrown at the Romanian Embassy in Tel Aviv on Wednsday, causing a small fire at a nearby construction site, Israel Television said. No injuries were reported. The attack appeared to be in protest against Romania's suppression of anti-government demonstrations in Timisoara, where hundreds reportedly died. The Foreign Ministry earlier expressed Israel's ``deep sorrow'' over the loss of life in Romania and said it hoped Romanian authorities would act with restraint and in accordance with ``humane norms.''
